verses.verse: Is there not an appointed time <WH6635> to man <WH582> upon earth <WH776>? are not his days <WH3117> also like the days <WH3117> of an hireling <WH7916> ?
As a servant <WH5650> earnestly desireth <WH7602> <WH8799> the shadow <WH6738>, and as an hireling <WH7916> looketh <WH6960> <WH8762> for the reward of his work <WH6467>:
So am I made to possess <WH5157> <WH8717> months <WH3391> of vanity <WH7723>, and wearisome <WH5999> nights <WH3915> are appointed <WH4487> <WH8765> to me.

When I lie down <WH7901> <WH8804>, I say <WH559> <WH8804>, When shall I arise <WH6965> <WH8799>, and the night <WH6153> be gone <WH4059>? and I am full <WH7646> <WH8804> of tossings to and fro <WH5076> unto the dawning of the day <WH5399>.
My flesh <WH1320> is clothed <WH3847> <WH8804> with worms <WH7415> and clods <WH1487> of dust <WH6083>; my skin <WH5785> is broken <WH7280> <WH8804>, and become loathsome <WH3988> <WH8735>.
My days <WH3117> are swifter <WH7043> <WH8804> than a weaver's shuttle <WH708>, and are spent <WH3615> <WH8799> without <WH657> hope <WH8615>.
O remember <WH2142> <WH8798> that my life <WH2416> is wind <WH7307>: mine eye <WH5869> shall no more <WH7725> <WH8799> see <WH7200> <WH8800> good <WH2896>.
The eye <WH5869> of him that hath seen <WH7210> me shall see <WH7789> <WH8799> me no more: thine eyes <WH5869> are upon me, and I am not.
As the cloud <WH6051> is consumed <WH3615> <WH8804> and vanisheth away <WH3212> <WH8799>: so he that goeth down <WH3381> <WH8802> to the grave <WH7585> shall come up <WH5927> <WH8799> no more.
He shall return <WH7725> <WH8799> no more to his house <WH1004>, neither shall his place <WH4725> know <WH5234> <WH8686> him any more.

Therefore I will not refrain <WH2820> <WH8799> my mouth <WH6310>; I will speak <WH1696> <WH8762> in the anguish <WH6862> of my spirit <WH7307>; I will complain <WH7878> <WH8799> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul <WH5315>.
Am I a sea <WH3220>, or a whale <WH8577>, that thou settest <WH7760> <WH8799> a watch <WH4929> over me?
When I say <WH559> <WH8804>, My bed <WH6210> shall comfort <WH5162> <WH8762> me, my couch <WH4904> shall ease <WH5375> <WH8799> my complaint <WH7879>;
Then thou scarest <WH2865> <WH8765> me with dreams <WH2472>, and terrifiest <WH1204> <WH8762> me through visions <WH2384>:
So that my soul <WH5315> chooseht <WH977> <WH8799> strangling <WH4267>, and death <WH4194> rather than my life <WH6106>.
I loathe <WH3988> <WH8804> it; I would not live <WH2421> <WH8799> alway <WH5769>: let me alone <WH2308> <WH8798>; for my days <WH3117> are vanity <WH1892>.
What is man <WH582>, that thou shouldest magnify <WH1431> <WH8762> him? and that thou shouldest set <WH7896> <WH8799> thine heart <WH3820> upon him?
And that thou shouldest visit <WH6485> <WH8799> him every morning <WH1242>, and try <WH974> <WH8799> him every moment <WH7281> ?
How long <WH4100> wilt thou not depart <WH8159> <WH8799> from me, nor let me alone <WH7503> <WH8686> till I swallow down <WH1104> <WH8800> my spittle <WH7536> ?

I have sinned <WH2398> <WH8804>; what shall I do <WH6466> <WH8799> unto thee, O thou preserver <WH5341> <WH8802> of men <WH120>? why hast thou set <WH7760> <WH8804> me as a mark <WH4645> against thee, so that I am a burden <WH4853> to myself?

And why dost thou not pardon <WH5375> <WH8799> my transgression <WH6588>, and take away <WH5674> <WH8686> mine iniquity <WH5771>? for now shall I sleep <WH7901> <WH8799> in the dust <WH6083>; and thou shalt seek me in the morning <WH7836> <WH8765>, but I shall not be.
